summary: This is an email from July 5, 2019, detailing operational plans for the imminent arrest of Jeffrey Epstein at Teterboro Airport. It outlines coordination between law enforcement agents and Customs and Border Protection (CBP) to detain Epstein upon his arrival, process other passengers, and conduct subsequent witness approaches.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: The subject of a planned arrest by law enforcement agents upon his arrival at Teterboro Airport via private flight.

events.title: Planning call for Epstein arrest
events.description: Law enforcement agents held a follow-up call to confirm plans for arresting Jeffrey Epstein upon his arrival at Teterboro Airport. They coordinated with CBP to detain him during passenger processing.

events.title: Planned arrest of Jeffrey Epstein
events.description: The operational plan was for CBP to detain Jeffrey Epstein when he disembarked from his private flight at Teterboro Airport, after which federal agents would take him into custody. Agents also planned to interview all other passengers on site.

keyFacts: Law enforcement had a confirmed CBP alert ("hit") specific to Jeffrey Epstein and his aircraft's tail number, indicating they were tracking his flight.
The arrest plan involved CBP at Teterboro detaining Epstein during standard passenger processing for private flights, after which federal agents would take custody.
Agents planned to attempt interviews of all other passengers on Epstein's flight immediately following the arrest.

Additional investigative approaches (likely witness interviews or searches) were planned for multiple individuals in NYC, another location, and Connecticut, with some scheduled for the days following the arrest.
The email indicates coordination between federal prosecutors and agents, with plans for victim interviews and for some personnel to travel to Florida to join approach teams later in the week.
